intro: Psephellus trinervius, commonly known as the three-veined psephellus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have three distinct veins, giving it its scientific name. The flowers are small and yellow, often appearing in clusters, and bloom during the cooler months of the year.
